New Records: Argentina's 2-0 win over Canada marked their third major crown after the 2021 Copa America and the 2022 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Argentina took the lead in the 22nd minute with a goal from Julian Alvarez, and Lionel Messi scored in the 51st minute to make it 2-0.
Canada captain Alphonso Davies was injured in a hard tackle by Gonzalo Montiel in the 71st minute.
There was some bad blood late in the game, with Argentina upset at Canadian midfielder Ismael Kone petulantly kicking the ball into one of their fallen players.
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina came into the semifinal having lost just once in 18 games (16-1-1) since defeating France via penalty shootout in the World Cup final in December 2022.
Canada, the last survivor of the six CONCACAF guest teams, is making its Copa debut.
Post-Match Reflections: Messi said, “It’s insane what this team has done, what the Argentina national team is doing. For those who remain from the old guard, it’s beyond impressive that the national team is in another final.”
Canada heads to Bank of America Stadium in Charlotte for Saturday's third-place game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at MetLife Stadium, home of the NFL's New York Giants and Jets, as well as the venue for the 2026 FIFA World Cup final.
Canada's goalkeeper Max Crepeau was called into action in the dying seconds of the half after Jonathan David got to an Alistair Johnston long throw-in.
The Canadian men were looking to reach their first tournament final since the 2000 Gold Cup when they upset Colombia to win the CONCACAF crown.
Others: Canada's Cyle Larin and Argentina's Cristian Romero vie for the ball during a Copa America semifinal soccer match in East Rutherford, N.J., Tuesday, July 9, 2024.
